Riddle: I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
Heading: Put Me Out

Riddle: What runs around the whole yard without moving?
Heading: Keep Out

Riddle: Two fathers and two sons went fishing one day. They were there the whole day and only caught 3 fish. One father said, that is enough for all of us, we will have one each. How can this be possible?
Heading: Enough Fish For All IQ Test
Answer: There was the father, his son, and his son's son. This equals 2 fathers and 2 sons for a total of 3!

Riddle: What can you catch but never throw?
Heading: Heads Up

Riddle: A bus driver was heading down a street in Colorado. He went right past a stop sign without stopping, he turned left where there was a "no left turn" sign, and he went the wrong way on a one-way street. Then he went on the left side of the road past a cop car. Still - he didn't break any traffic laws.  Why not?
Heading: The Bus Driver Riddle

Riddle: What 4-letter word can be written forward, backward or upside down, and can still be read from left to right?
Heading: That's A Cool Word

Riddle: How can you leave a room with two legs and return with six legs?
Heading: Six Legs Riddle
Answer: Bring a chair back with you.

Riddle: A man in a car saw a Golden Door, Silver Door and a Bronze Door. What door did he open first?
Heading: Use Common Sense, U Can Ans This

Riddle: If you were running a race, and you passed the person in 2nd place, what place would you be in now?
Heading: Racing
Answer: You would be in the 2nd place. You thought first place, right? Well, you passed the guy in second place, not first.

Riddle: Railroad Crossing, look out for the cars. Can you spell that, without any R's?

Riddle: A horse was tied to a rope 5 meters long and the horses food was 15 meters away from the horse. How did the horse reach the food?
Heading: Horse Food
Answer: The rope wasn't tied to anything so he could reach the food.

Riddle:
It has a long neck, A name of a bird, Feeds on cargo of ships, It's not alive,


What is it?
Heading: Long Neck

Riddle: What two things can you never eat for breakfast?

Riddle: You can see it everyday, But cannot touch it at will. What is it?
Heading: Untouchable

Riddle: A man was found murdered on Sunday morning. His wife immediately called the police. The police questioned the wife and staff and got these alibis: The Wife said she was sleeping. The Cook was cooking breakfast. The Gardener was picking vegetables. The Maid was getting the mail. The Butler was cleaning the closet. The police instantly arrested the murderer. Who did it and how did they know?
Heading: Murder Suspects!
Answer: It was the Maid. She said she was getting the mail. There is no mail on Sunday!

Riddle:
If a boy blows 18 bubbles, 
 Then pops 6 eats 7 and then 
 He pops 5 and blows 1. 
 How many are left?
Heading: 7up...

Answer: They are survivors, you don't bury them.

Riddle: I have holes on the top and bottom. I have holes on my left and on my right. And I have holes in the middle, yet I still hold water. What am I?

Riddle:
There are 2 cops parked along a one-way street looking for traffic violations. They spot a taxi driver going in the wrong direction, yet they do nothing.


Why?
Heading: Traffic Violations
Answer: The taxi driver wasn't driving at the time, he was walking.

Answer: The other end is not tied to anything.

Riddle: If there are fifteen crows on a fence and the farmer shoots a third of them, how many crows are left?
Heading: Counting Crows
Answer: None. The rest of the crows flew away when they heard the gunshot.

Riddle: You are a bus driver at a station. 10 get on the bus and no one gets off. You drive 10 miles to another station where 3 people get on and 1 gets off. You drive another 10 miles only to get 25 people on and 5 people go off. Next you drive 3 miles while 12 people exit the bus. You drive back to the place knowing that a couple more stops along the way untill the ride is done. At the 2nd to last station 5 people get on and 2 get off. And at the last station (5.5 miles) 25 people get on for no reason and 1 gets off. What is the bus drivers eye color?
Heading: Bus Driver
Answer: Brown/blue/green (i don't know how i would put it though so if you guessed your eye color you got it right :) )

Riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no-body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
Heading: I Speak Without A Mouth And Hear Without Ears...

It's the only vegetable or fruit that is never sold frozen, canned, processed, cooked, or in any other form but fresh.


What is it?

I come across as flat,


But theirs more to me than my surface;


You climb my moutains from top to bottom,


And fall from bottom to top.


What am I?
Heading: More To Me

Riddle: Donny was driving his semi under an overpass when suddenly he came to a screeching halt. Donny wasn't paying enough attention and inadvertently drove under the overpass that was just barely as high as his truck. The semi was wedged so tightly that he could not go forward or backward. A fellow trucker came by and told him how he could easily get the semi out from under the bridge. What did he suggest?
Heading: Wedged Semi
Answer: He told Don to let some air out of his tires. This would make the truck lower and allow him to pass through.

Riddle:
On a fine sunny day a ship was in the harbor. All of a sudden the ship began to sink. There was no storm and nothing wrong with the ship yet it sank right in front of the spectators eyes. 
 What caused the ship to sink?

I then thought that I would be a doctor so that I could help people in a similar way. What is the defect in this story?
